title: San Francisco Citywide Performance Metrics
description: A. SUMMARY This data set reports key performance metrics for departments and programs in the City and County of San Francisco. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED City departments report updates about their key metrics to the Controller’s Office. The Controller's Office uses an online application to collect and organize this data. Departments update most metrics once or twice each year. Some metrics may not display data for every year. C. UPDATE PROCESS Most metrics update twice each year. Updates with results for the first 6 months of each fiscal year are published in the spring, typically between April and May. Updates with results for each full fiscal year are published in the fall, typically in November. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET Each row represents one metric and one fiscal year for a department, with multiple values for each fiscal year. Some metrics do not include values for all fields or fiscal years. Some results for the latest fiscal year are unavailable because of known lags in reporting. Users should review any data notes reported for each row for guidance about interpreting values. All values are reported as numbers without formatting, but the column [Measure Data Type] describes the intended format. For example, a value appearing as “0.50” with [Measure Data Type] reported as “Percent” should be displayed as “50%”.

columns.name: Department Name
columns.description: Parent: The department responsible for collecting and reporting the data associated with the metric

columns.name: Strategic Goal
columns.description: Parent: The strategic goal with which the measure is associated.  There is at least one goal for each department and it usually corresponds to the department's strategic plan.

columns.name: Measure Title
columns.description: Parent: The descriptive title of the measure .  Each Strategic goal has at least one metric.

columns.name: Measure Description
columns.description: Parent: A short summary describing the measure

columns.name: Measure Methodology
columns.description: Parent: A technical description of how the measure is defined, calculated, or monitored.

columns.name: Measure Data Type
columns.description: Parent: The type of numeric value expected for each measure , such as: numeric, percent, or currency.  The type is important in the QuickBase database, which stores all the performance measure data.

columns.name: Fiscal Year
columns.description: Child: The fiscal year described by each value. San Francisco's fiscal year begins July 1 and ends June 30 of the following calendar year. The fiscal year number reflects the calendar year in which the fiscal year ended: for example, FY2018-19 began July 1, 2018 and ended June 30, 2019.  Each measure has at least one FY.

columns.name: End Calendar Year
columns.description: Child: The calendar year in which the fiscal year ends

columns.name: Target
columns.description: Child: The estimated result or objective for the measure during each fiscal year. The target for a fiscal year is defined at or before the beginning of that fiscal year.

columns.name: Mid-Year Result
columns.description: Child: The actual value or result of the measure 6 months into each fiscal year (December 31). Some metrics may define a different date or period.

columns.name: Mid-Year Projection
columns.description: Child: The estimated result for the full fiscal year (at year end). This estimate is made during the middle (6 month mark) of each fiscal year.

columns.name: Full-Year Result
columns.description: Child: The actual value or result of the measure at the end of each fiscal year (June 30)

columns.name: Data Notes
columns.description: Child: Notes describing important considerations for each value

whom_it_may_interest: City Officials, Policy Makers, Financial Analysts, Researchers studying city performance metrics, and Departments within the city of San Francisco for strategic planning and evaluation purposes.

queries.Monthly: SELECT department_name, strategic_goal, measure_title, fiscal_year, SUM(target) AS target, SUM(mid_year_result) AS mid_year_result, SUM(mid_year_projection) AS mid_year_projection, SUM(full_year_result) AS full_year_result WHERE fiscal_year >= start_date GROUP BY department_name, strategic_goal, measure_title, fiscal_year ORDER BY fiscal_year
queries.Yearly: SELECT department_name, strategic_goal, measure_title, fiscal_year, SUM(target) AS target, SUM(mid_year_result) AS mid_year_result, SUM(mid_year_projection) AS mid_year_projection, SUM(full_year_result) AS full_year_result WHERE fiscal_year >= start_date GROUP BY department_name, strategic_goal, measure_title, fiscal_year ORDER BY fiscal_year
